alert.note: Alert for Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 4:35PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Morton County. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 433 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... rural areas of Morton County between Almont and Interstate 94.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
